subject: Sexual Health
title: The Comstock Laws
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Comstock Laws.

hook.text: In 1873, the United States made it illegal to mail any information about contraception.

buildup.text: The Comstock Act classified birth control information as obscene material under federal law.

discovery.text: Doctors, educators, and activists faced arrest simply for discussing how to prevent pregnancy.

twist.text: Margaret Sanger was arrested in 1916 for opening a birth control clinic. She kept fighting regardless.

climax.text: The Comstock era showed that criminalizing health information harms the very people it claims to protect.

punchline.text: Banning information never stopped the need for it.

quiz.question: What did the Comstock Act of 1873 prohibit?
